Text.val: Author: Stephan Huppertz
Created by Hein Ferman <13-06-2001
29.03.2012 SH SCR17202 Removed PI.BADP_BANKIDDEBTOR/PI.BADP_BANKACCOUNTDEBTOR (no longer modifiable)
21.03.2012 SH SCR17182 Removed public name
28.02.2008 SH SCR13446 Removed the whole advances handling
19.04.2006 SH SCR10986 Added new test for draft handling
05.11.2003 SH SCR4700 Set BADP_UNALLOCATED = TRUE if payment could not
- be closed, if OPH101C was called from OPH104
04.09.2003 SH SCR4258 If ADML_LTYP_TYPE = 5 then the fields
- BADP_ADMNOINITIAL / BADP_CLNTNOINITIAL / BADP_ADMNOLEDGER and
- BADP_LEDGER are all mandatory, means multiple criterias are possible now -->
- BADP_CLNTNOINITIAL and BADP_LEDGER
11.06.2003 SH SCR3666 Added new para pi.Messages and only if pi.Messages = TRUE
- the diff GB007 calls will be executed.
24.04.2003 SH SCR3392 "Check Cheque" Replaced PI.AMOUNTACCCURR by
- PI.AMOUNTPAYCURR to calculate the difference
04.12.2002 SCR1781 SH Add test on "Assigning payments - Client" -> Split payment
- this is the 8. possibility to handled a payment
12.08.2002 SH IF OPH101C was called from OPH104 and the flag unallocated
- was reset to 'Y' the payment could not be closed
-- 17.07.2002 SCR1691 SH Add new field "BADP_DAILYRUNNUMBER" to obtain
- table BADT with primary key
There are 8 ways to assign a payment:
Entering a clientnumber, a ledger number, book unallocated, transfer
back to debtor, via Cheques, via Ledger, via Advances or via Assigning payments
to Clients
Just to be sure this program will check the assigning via one
and not more of these 8 possibilities.
If there is no choice and all these possibilities are left empty
this is an error too.
-- Set payment to handled/unhandled if payment was not splittet with OPH101C4,
-- in this case the po.BADP_NPAYMENTSHANDLED = 0
-- see remark in the task above
check if there are cheques entered
check if there are drafts entered
check if there are ledgers entered
-- check if payment was splittet
more then 1 possibility in the effort to assign this payment
assigning via cheques-, ledge-, advances or drafts screen
no possibilities used only if amounts fully specified in the detail screen,
see above, otherwise go back to OPH101C
-- IF OPH101C called from OPH101, ask user if he wants to handle the next paymen
-- Give user message, that payment can't be handle, only if OPH101C not called
-- from OPH101
-- OPH101C was called from OPH104 and after some changes in OPH101C the flag
- unallocated was reset to TRUE the payment could not be closed
-- OPH101C was called from OPH104 and if the payment could not be closed, then
-- BADP_UNALLOCATED has to be set to TRUE, otherwise the payment will removed
-- from the view of OPH104 and is also not in the view of OPH101
